root: ^That took a little longer than I thought it would. Rishi is trying to break down the door. In the meantime, lets do this.

DoorOption: ^I think we should help rishi out and get out of here
^Alright sounds good, are you should we'll be ok?
help: ^Fine we can bring him in as long as we exorcise the ghost
^Girish and you walk towards the fence near the edge of the garden and try using a wedge to break through the links.
^The fence burst open under the force and Rishi walks in.
^No. We were assigned to this case, and I’m not going to let it up simply because you were left out of it
^So somehow that’s my fault? Do you not understand how alarming all this is? Where’s Diego?
^We need to finish this; we can’t let Don die in vain.
^If you want to stay here, then suit yourself. Hey, are you coming?

^I agree with Rishi, I don’t remember much of what happened a few hours ago but I don’t want anymore to do with it. Somebody died in this building today and that should be enough to leave this and report it.
^You can do what you want, I’m going to finish this.
^If we’re going to report this then we need some evidence, do you know if Diego found anything that could be used as proof.
^He didn’t get to, but I did.
^You lead Rishi over to the sofas and lays down the clues, with the final one being a picture of Girish with a woman.
^This woman, that’s the spirit that is haunting this building.
^She just, she seemed… familiar? She called me Jorge...
^Jorge? What does that have to do with anyth-
^What’s wrong? Wait, none of this makes any sense. How do I know this woman? Why is Girish with her
^I remember I was running away; the question is from what? Girish being in this picture with her doesn’t make any sense, like at all!
^Yeah, it does, I believe Girish is dangerous and we need to leave. Now, before he gets back.
^Footsteps are heard around the corner as Girish is seen rounding it.
^Great job. I didn’t think I’d need to do this.
^Girish shoves Rishi to the ground and charges at you
^Girish is shoved to the ground while Rishi pounces on him. Leaving him unconscious.

s: ^huff* *huff* Thank you, what is going on?

c-0: ^The right thing. I’m gonna call the cops, you need to get on out of here.
^And leave you alone with him? No way. I’ll wait here-
^Rishi? *you feel a cold hand on your shoulder*
^Jorge turns around and is met with bloodshot eyes. The entity places a finger on his forehead
^You wouldn’t have understood. Now you’ve brought me peace, and to yourself. I hope you can forgive me in another life for what I did, I know what I did was wrong, and it cost us.
^But I will make it up to you someday. Till next time, my love. Farewell
^I don’t think I have the time to tell you. I do have the time to thank you, for what you’ve done for me. If it weren’t for you, I wouldn’t be free, you’ve helped me find peace. Thank you, Rishi.
^Uh, no problem? What do you mean no-“?

nohelp: ^We’ll be fine on our own, he already told me the firm has authorities on the way. Let’s just get this over with...
^Alright then. He’s acting strange... Hey Girish... I found something strange that involves
^The screen pulses a cyan color twice, and Jorge falls to the ground in pain.
^Jorge turns his head to see Girish holding a cross and looking at him.
^What are you doing!? How is he doing this?
^No reason to explain to a dead man
